sense.name: behave unnaturally (with intent to deceive); act fictitiously
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] PRETEND TO NP2 NP1[agent] PRETEND (that) NP2
sense.examples: Should Hillary pretend to be a flight attendant? I'm pretending to be a tiger! Rawr! Bogus calls pretend to be the police. Pretend (that) the world has ended. Let's pretend!

sense.name: put forward a claim and/or assert possession of; feign or act, usually with intent to deceive; play a role for personal gain.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] PRETEND NP2 NOTE: In this sense the verb is almost always followed by an NP. When it is followed by the infinitive of a verb, that verb must be a verb of cognition (know, think, believe etc)
sense.examples: Never pretend to a love which you do not feel. He pretended the title of King. Melody pretended the role of predator in The Black Forest. I cannot pretend to know the truth.
